string-array.item: Standing at 869 metres above sea level, Table Mountain rises from the ocean
Standing at 669 metres above sea level, Lion\'s Head forms part of the dramatic backdrop of Cape Town

A promonotory at the southeast corner of the Cape Peninsula, which is a mountainious and scenic landform that runs north-south for about thirty kilometres at the extreme southwestern tip of the African continent in the Republic of South Africa
En-route to the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront, stop at the Two Oceans Aquarium, to observe multiple different species of sea life
The large Cape winery district offers a wide selection of wines to taste. The wine district stretches from Stellenbosch all the way to the Boland
Located along cape\'s scenic Campsbay Drive, and the only pet-friendly hotel in Cape Town. Visitors can be sure that the menu for both human and pet is put together by certified vets and dieticians

With a variety of well-appointed guest rooms and suites with private balconies overlooking the Cape Peninsula. Food and drink amenities include a bar and free BBQ facilities. For those that want to relax, a free spa and wellness center is offered, with two outdoor spas, and sauna. An indoor pool is also on site
Definitely drop-in at Golden Dish, for delicious Cape Malay dishes, in a variety of flavours, and portions. From fish and chips, to gatsby\'s, to chicken, and much more
